Key Match Events: Anthony Edwards scored 19 points in the third quarter to put the game away for good
The Timberwolves scored the game's first 10 points and the Portland Trail Blazers missed their first 10 shots
Rudy Gobert recorded all three of his blocks in the game's opening minutes
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Edwards said, 'I'm not like shocked or anything because I worked so hard for it. I worked so hard on my trey ball, so it's like, 'Here we go, this is what's supposed to happen.' Hopefully it keep going that way.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rudy Gobert set the defensive tone early for the Wolves
The Wolves opened the second quarter on an 11-2 run
The game was so well in hand late that the Wolves were able to empty their bench
Rob Dillingham drilled a 3-pointer, the first of his career, with just under four minutes to play
Others: The Timberwolves (6-3) won their third straight game
The sold-out Target Center crowd was electric when Dillingham drilled a 3-pointer
Julius Randle scored eight of those points, including a pair of 3-pointers in the second quarter
